text: Hans Georg Conried Jr. (April 15, 1917January 5, 1982) was an Austrian- American actor and comedian. He was born in Baltimore, Maryland. Conried voiced George Darling and Captain Hook in Peter Pan (1953), Snidely Whiplash in Jay Ward's Dudley Do-Right cartoons, Professor Waldo P. Wigglesworth in Ward's Hoppity Hooper cartoons, and Professor Kropotkin on the radio and movie versions of My Friend Irma. He also appeared as Uncle Tonoose on Danny Thomas' sitcom Make Room for Daddy, and in multiple roles on I Love Lucy. Conried died in Burbank, California on January 5, 1982 of a heart attack, aged 64. ==References== Category:1917 births Category:1992 deaths Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction Category:American movie actors Category:American television actors Category:American stage actors Category:American radio actors Category:American voice actors Category:Actors from Baltimore Category:Comedians from Baltimore
title: Hans Conried
